name: ASUC Office of the Executive Vice President
description:
The Associated Students of the University of California (ASUC) is UC Berkeley's official student government, The Executive Vice President (EVP) manages all internal affairs of student government, leads the ASUC Senate, ensures transparent and effective student government operations, oversees ASUC commercial activities, and serves as a vital representative for all students’ needs to the university administration and external organizations.

 

The Office of the Executive Vice President supports student organizing in all spheres. The office is a supportive partner and ally to the ASUC Senate, facilitating the success of the Senate’s collective vision while assisting with its outreach and visibility. Offering financial and networking resources, leadership development, and empowerment opportunities, we strive to provide students with an environment that allows them to create positive change in their areas of their interest. We work to build a more vibrant and inclusive campus community through collaborative events, coalition building, providing access to space and funding resources, and engaging as many students as possible in major campus decisions. Our hope to is to move towards a better UC Berkeley founded on values of inclusivity and thriving student life.

 

This year, EVP Isha Chander was elected to the role to lead projects to support transfer & nontraditional students, environmental justice initiatives, students’ rights, and basic needs availability; improve access to spaces, funding, and services on campus that improve the well-being of students and the success of student clubs; process and Approve contracts between the ASUC and the University/ external organizations (such as the Wall Street Journal and New York Times subscriptions; focus on connecting frequently with clubs and community caucuses; and continue all of her advocacy from her term as an ASUC Senator.

 

If you're interested in getting involved in student government, come work with us! You’ll be able to gain experience in student government alongside a team that’s passionate, committed to service, and student centric.

 

To review the office structure chart and available positions, please visit: tinyurl.com/OEVPPositions
To learn more about EVP Chander and our office, please visit @ucbvicepresident on Instagram.
To apply to the office, please visit: tinyurl.com/OEVPPositions


APPLICATION DEADLINES:
Phase 1 (priority deadline): July 27 at 11:59pm
Phase 2: September 5th at 11:59pm


Questions about applying? Reach out to the Chiefs of Staff at evpchief@asuc.org or DM us on Instagram! We hope to see your application.
summary: The Office of the ASUC Executive Vice President is committed to developing quality student life and a stronger culture of community on the UC Berkeley campus.
